comments:
If a plugin descriptor has following expression as a platform filter - 
"(! (osgi.os=macosx))". This 
results in the exceptions similar to the one listed below on workbench startup and shutdown:
Exception in thread "State Saver" java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.util.Hashtable.get(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.internal.resolver.StateWriter.saveState(StateWriter.java:121)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.internal.resolver.StateObjectFactoryImpl.writeState(StateObjectFactoryImpl.java:
337)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.internal.baseadaptor.StateManager.writeState(StateManager.java:187)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.internal.baseadaptor.StateManager.update(StateManager.java:126)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.internal.baseadaptor.BaseStorage.saveStateData(BaseStorage.java:545)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.internal.baseadaptor.BaseStorage.saveAllData(BaseStorage.java:383)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.internal.baseadaptor.BaseStorage.access$1(BaseStorage.java:372)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.internal.baseadaptor.BaseStorage$StateSaver.run(BaseStorage.java:1115)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)


There don't appear to be any consequences perceivable by a user except for the log entries.

As a workaround, if you change the expression to (|(osgi.os=linux)(osgi.os=win32)) no exceptions is thrown.

This looks like an Eclipse platform bug. See org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FilterImpl#1387. 
The code expects array of "FilterImpl" but in case of unary expression the value is a single "FilterImpl" object.

This has been fixed in 3.3 RC2.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 188075 ***
